Books.Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Books.Author: Harper Lee
Books.Description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

Books.Author: George Orwell
Books.Description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

Books.Title: The Great Gatsby
Books.Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Books.Description: A novel about the American dream and the roaring twenties.

Books.Title: Moby-Dick
Books.Author: Herman Melville
Books.Description: A novel about the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod.

Books.Title: Pride and Prejudice
Books.Author: Jane Austen
Books.Description: A romantic novel about manners and matrimonial machinations.

Books.Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Books.Author: J.D. Salinger
Books.Description: A novel about the challenges of teenage life and rebellion.

Books.Title: Brave New World
Books.Author: Aldous Huxley
Books.Description: A novel set in a futuristic world of genetically modified citizens.

Books.Title: Jane Eyre
Books.Author: Charlotte Bronte
Books.Description: A novel about the experiences of the orphan Jane Eyre.

Books.Title: War and Peace
Books.Author: Leo Tolstoy
Books.Description: A novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia.

Books.Title: Crime and Punishment
Books.Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Books.Description: A novel about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of a poor ex-student.

Books.Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Books.Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Books.Description: A philosophical novel that explores ethical debates and moral issues.

Books.Title: Wuthering Heights
Books.Author: Emily Bronte
Books.Description: A novel about the intense and almost demonic love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.
